summary: A colorful ENB with a fantasy feel
descriptionHtml:
Yet Another ENB-

-This is a Work in progress ENB setting, feel free to comment, make suggestions, endorse etc.
-I am using Heliodoublesix\'s effect.txt (-HD6 Dark Nights Mod)  so all credit goes to him and Borris (The ENB God), I simply tweaked the settings.

HD6 Dark Nights mod - http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=4142
ENBseries by Boris Vorontsov - http://enbdev.com/ or http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=2971


Install- Simply copy contents of .rar into your main skyrim folder (Where your Skyrimlauncher.exe file is)
Uninstall-Simply delete these files from main skyrim folder

*Note that SSAO is turned ON, this can be taxing on your system, and if necessary, you can turn it off by opening the enbseries.ini
notepad, and turning EnableAmbientOcclusion=true to =false

**In Data/skyrimPrefs.ini you will want to change these settings IF using SSAO (again this SSAO is on by default)

bFloatPointRenderTarget=1
iMultiSample=1 (MSAA may duff up SSAO)
bFXAAEnabled=1

In Game Hot Keys:

Adjust Brightness at night/indoors/dungeon- Hold 1 and press page up/down
-It will always default to a set level when you start the game, I think it looks best when you hit page down three or 4 times, but to each his own.
-Thanks to Heliodoublesix for this stroke of brilliance

Turn off/on ENB completely - Shift + f12

Turn off/on FXAA + Sharpen - Pause/break

Show FPS - *

Load Config file - Backspace (if you are editing)


** If you are interested in adjusting the settings yourself, may I suggest running Skyrim in windowed mode
and then make small adjustments (start with enbseries.ini), save, and then alt-tab back to Skyrim and press BACKSPACE to see the change (Backspace reads config file)

Some Issues:

Loading screens look a bit weird/bloomy
Sunrise/set (esp set) is overbearing too bright/red
Some things a night glow too much (I.e Nirnroot, fog over water)
water from a distance looks strange, too reflective?


Performance:
ENB is taxing to any system, for example, I have a Medium/highend system with a 3ghz q9650, 8 gigs of ram, and a 560 gpu and I get about 24-30 fps on ultra with 1080 resolution and SSAO turned on.  With SSAO off I get about 4 or 5 fps gain, YMMV.
TESV Acceleration Layer helps as well - http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=4387
author: ShrugLife
